titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to Janice C. Neal papers, 1962-1964.
titlestmt.author: Pamela Cooley

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid created with EADitor by user nycoofam.
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

processinfo.p: The processing, cataloging, and encoding of this collection were made possible by a grant from the Gladys Krieble Delmas.

acqinfo.p: Gift; Alma Slawson, Oneonta, NY; 1984; NM-33.84.
acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information

accessrestrict.p: Coll. No. 468 is open for research according to the regulations of Fenimore Art Museum Library.

bioghist.p: Janice Neal, child of Frank E Neal, 1869-1952 and Minnie E. Miller Neal, b. 1872, was a lifelong resident of Oneonta, Otsego County, NY. She studied at the State University of New York in Albany, became a public school teacher in Unadilla, Otsego County, NY, and was a member of several historical organizations. A pamphlet of her writing, “Otsego County Bits and Pieces,” was published posthumously.
bioghist.head: Biography/History

scopecontent.p: Contains 67 personal letters and 5 work books of genealogical notes. The bulk of the letters (45 in all) are written by Janice Neal to “Cousin Blanche” (possibly Mrs. Fred Wood) between 1961-1961. Neal writes of her activities at school, in organizations, and at church, of friends, nature, local news, and of the books she is reading and the genealogical research she is doing.
scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Also included are 21 letters to Neal from Earle F. Peacox, Webster, Montgomery County, NY. These letters focus primarily on genealogical research. The 5 genealogical work books include handwritten notes on families, and cemetery and church records and other sources of documentary evidence. Family names include: Miller, deGraff, Bush, and Stancil/Stansell.
Neal is a very good letter writer.
